item.title: Ryan Tedder: Classic songs are strangling new music
item.description: New bands don't have a chance because everyone is streaming Queen and ABBA, says the OneRepublic star.

item.title: Morecambe and Wise 'bored stiff' by Monty Python
item.description: The comedy double act shared their thoughts in an unearthed 1973 interview for a student TV station.

item.title: Time's Up boss quits over ties to scandal-hit Cuomo
item.description: Tina Tchen is second Time's Up resignation in connection with politician accused of harassing women.

item.title: Tom Cruise's BMW stolen during Mission: Impossible filming
item.description: The BMW X7 was stolen from Church Street, Birmingham, near to the hotel where the actor was staying.

item.title: Festivals: Drug supply issues and low tolerance add to overdose fears
item.description: Disruptions could mean people inadvertently take stronger or more dangerous drugs, campaigners say.

item.title: Antony Gormley art unveiled outside Wells Cathedral
item.description: The human figure made from cast iron is installed in front of Wells Cathedral in Somerset.

item.title: Books: Bid for more diverse heroes in Welsh children's stories
item.description: Author Jessica Dunrod says it's important for black children to see themselves in literature.

item.title: Abba: Band teases major announcement ahead of new music
item.description: The band, who have not released new music for 39 years, reveal a new project called Abba Voyage.

item.title: Frozen: Can the stage musical recreate the film's magic?
item.description: Some critics are sceptical, but London's Anna and Elsa say the stage adaptation will please fans.

item.title: Charlie Watts: The subtle magnificence of the Rolling Stones' drummer
item.description: He wasn't flashy or prone to pyrotechnics, but Charlie Watts was the heartbeat of the Rolling Stones.

item.title: Love Island: Is the dating show's honeymoon phase over?
item.description: The ITV show sparked record complaints, so as the latest series ends, is the magic starting to fade?

item.title: Charlie Watts: The life of a Rolling Stone in pictures
item.description: A look back at the life of the iconic rock 'n' roll drummer, who has died at the age of 80.

item.title: Clive Myrie: Becoming host of Mastermind is a big, big job
item.description: The journalist may be feeling jittery about his new role but hopes it will reveal his lighter side.

item.title: Charlie Watts obituary: Jazz man who became rock superstar
item.description: The drummer kept his feet firmly on the ground despite the success of the Rolling Stones.

item.title: Barakat: First South African film in Cape Town's Afrikaans dialect
item.description: Barakat, or blessing, is the first film in Afrikaaps - a dialect of Afrikaans spoken in Cape Town.

item.title: The musical Frozen gets ready to open on London's West End
item.description: The actresses playing Elsa and Anna describe their excitement at finally being able to 'Let It Go' on stage.

item.title: DJ to hold Ministry of Sound fundraiser for twin brother in Covid coma
item.description: The twin of a DJ who fell into a coma after catching Covid is holding a club night to raise money for his care.

item.title: Afghan singer Aryana Sayeed on fleeing the country
item.description: Afghan singer Aryana Sayeed on fleeing the country and her concerns for those who remain.

item.title: Charlie Watts: The Who and Chili Peppers drummers pay tribute
item.description: The Who's Kenney Jones and Red Hot Chili Peppers' Chad Smith pay tribute to the Rolling Stones drummer.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: 'Tom Cruise is in my Warwickshire garden'
item.description: A request to land a helicopter carrying an unnamed VIP leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.
